title: Torque and work - change in energy-variable torque

content.question: A horizontal disk is spinning around a fixed vertical axis through its center. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> the disk has an initial angular position <math alttext="theta equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and is rotating in the positive direction with a rotational kinetic energy of <math alttext="60 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></math>. A torque <math alttext="tau as a function of theta, equals, 4.0 newton meters minus, open parenthesis, 0.25 newton meters per radian, close parenthesis, theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>τ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mtext>rad</mtext></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>θ</mi></math> is then exerted on the disk from <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> until the disk has rotated an angle <math alttext="theta equals 16 radians" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext></math>, at which time the torque has decreased to zero. What is the final rotational kinetic energy of the disk when the torque has reached zero?

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems
